snippet: Ikea said political prisoners from the former East Germany provided some of the labor that helped keep its prices so low.
abstract: Ikea admits that forced labor of political prisoners in former East Germany was used to make products in 1980s, helping keep its prices so low.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and JULIA WERDIGIER
byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Berlin, and Julia Werdigier from London. Chris Cottrell contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Ikea said political prisoners from the former East Germany provided some of the labor that helped keep its prices so low.

headline.seo: Ikea Admits Use of Forced Labor in the 1980s
headline.main: Ikea Admits Forced Labor Was Used in 1980s
headline.print_headline: Ikea Admits It Benefited From Forced Labor in ’80s
